website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Ballista is touted to be the lightest middle-distance track and field shoe in the market. With its lightweight and rigid composition, the Ballista will help power your ride. It is built to magnify your speed with its enhanced surface traction. For its price, many users claim that its qualities do not disappoint.
pros: According to some athletes, the Saucony Ballista enhanced their speed
Many admire the lightness of the shoe
It has excellent surface traction, declared some
Several purchasers commend the fit of the shoe
It delivers comfort, noted a number of runners
cons: The shoe quickly wears out, stated one purchaser
It can get easily hot within the shoe, a reviewer remarked

customer_reviews.title: Great spike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pair of spikes. The size was just right for my child who wears 9.5 shoes regularly. We ordered a 9.5 in this spike and the fit was just as expected with a small amount of room at the toe. He is very please with them and the travel bag that they came with. I highly recommend this spike.
customer_reviews.author: LMC

customer_reviews.title: the shoe guy at the running store felt he ran better in the 8
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my son for track, we tried same model on in store prior to purchase, but they where out of boys version. He wears an 8 1/2 in a running shoe, after trying on different sizes, the shoe guy at the running store felt he ran better in the 8. Running in spikes has taken significant time off his times on the track..5 seconds off 400 and 10 seconds off 800..which has made him very competitive.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey F.

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected.
customer_reviews.text: These track spikes fit my son as expected. He has ran the entire season in them, they held up well and performed exactly as we expected. A great purchase at a great price.

customer_reviews.title: Inside soles came out within 2 weeks of wear

Thank you for the excellent customer service when faced with a problem.

customer_reviews.title: 5 and it seems fine. The shoe is comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear an 11, so I got an 11.5 and it seems fine. The shoe is comfortable, and not narrow as some spikes can be. Definitely appropriate for sprinting (50m - 200m), but I wouldn't push it past that, as it is very lightweight, and the front of the shoe helps to dorsiflex (lifting the toes). Would not suggest for middle distance.

customer_reviews.text: In one days use the whole bottom became flat. They are pretty worthless without the spikes. Never had a track shoes that the plastic spikes would become flat. Don't waste your money one these overly prices things. The cost doesn't match the quality.

customer_reviews.text: These run true to size as far as width and overall feel, but they run long in the toe area. Otherwise they are good spikes. One spike has been lost already, but I'm wondering if that's typical for these types of shoes.

customer_reviews.title: Just grinding
customer_reviews.text: These were delivered to me early, which I was very pleased and elated about. The moment I opened the package and the box, I saw was... these amazing pair of spikes! I obviously do track and field and these look like a great pair of mid distance spikes. Anyways my season is just about a month away and I can't wait to use them!

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-distance track shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son for his 1,600 meters. Instant results...he went from a 4.56 PR to a 4.53 in his first race in these new shoes and he just ran a 4.45 in his second race. He does NOT wear these for the 3,200 event and his training is also to credit, but I will say these shoes have helped him significantly improve his time.
customer_reviews.author: ChaplainMac

customer_reviews.title: There's a catch
customer_reviews.text: I want to love these, I really do. I'm a competitive runner in college and I run many events from 4x4, 800, 1000, 1500, and mile. For 800 meters, these spikes are the best on the market...but not if you're trying to double, or race again the next day. They completely ruin your calves for your next race, and I've had some resounding calf problems from indoor, when I raced 6 times in one weekend. Theyre gonna wreck your calves, but if you have one race, and you're trying to lay down something nasty, these will get you there.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Martin

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, but fall to pieces
customer_reviews.text: WARNING - the upper is made of tissue paper - it tears incredibly easily & renders the shoe useless - poor design / material selection

product_meta.title: Saucony Ballista Running Spikes
product_meta.description: Saucony Ballista Running Spikes The Ballista is designed for the track star who is giving it everything they have in their mid-distance events. From the 800 metres to the mile, these lightweight, durable shoes can carry you to victory. Flexfilm Upper The upper of the Ballista Running Spike is constructed with Saucony's Flexfilm which is a strong, lightweight material allowing for fewer layers in the shoe, boosting a seamless, flexible feel while reducing the risk of irritation and discomfort. This adaptive material is melded to the mesh upper which allows much-needed airflow throughout the shoe, keeping the feet feeling cool and dry at all times, eliminating any distractions. Minimal Midsole The midsole of the Ballista is purposefully minimal as it's designed for fast, quick races. Keeping weight at a minimum is critical to the Ballista, so there would be no need to add extra cushioning to the midsole. 2-Part Plate Outsole The Ballista is Saucony's first spike to be engineered with multiple compounds to reduce weight while still provides rigidity underfoot. The underfoot comes with 6 spikes that are designed to propel you forward while hitting maximum speed. This versatile shoe allows you to remove the spikes and allows you to be ready to hit the track, trail, mud or pavement at any time. **You don't want to feel your toe cramped up against the front of the shoe. A spike should feel like it was meant for your foot, a little more snug than a training shoe feels so we would recommend half a size up on normal shoes**
feature_bullets: FlexFilm - Lightweight yet strong material allows for fewer layers in the upper for a seamless, flexible feel.
Mesh Upper - Provides a breathable environment, keeping the wearer cool and dry.
Minimal Midsole - Keeps weight down, ensuring faster runs.
2-Part Plate Outsole Reduces weight while still providing rigidity.
